definition: to profiteer/to gain some underhand advantage
to fish up/to dredge up
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
handle
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: Many merchants were not slow to cash in on the current China craze.
sentences.chinese: 许多商人都急于在流行的中国热中捞一把。

sentences.english: Lisacore thinks of nothing but making a market of the present confusions.
sentences.chinese: 利萨科尔一心想趁目前的混乱状况捞一把。

sentences.english: He wants to make a quick kill and take it home.
sentences.chinese: 他希望快速地捞一把，然后就把它带回家。

sentences.english: He tried to profiteer from this dirty deal.
sentences.chinese: 他想在这笔肮脏的交易中捞一把。

sentences.english: We thought that Egypt was a romantic country.
sentences.chinese: 我认为比尔是想伺机捞一把。

sentences.english: I thought Bill intended to be on the grab.
sentences.chinese: 我认为比尔是想伺机捞一把。

sentences.english: Both Thomas and Paul thought that a rise in the market would enable them to cash in .
sentences.chinese: 托马斯和保罗都认为市价上涨可以使他们捞一把。

definition: to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
to fish up/to dredge up
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to fish for/to seek profit (by improper means)
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to get one's money back (esp. gambling)/to recoup one's losings
to steal away/to beat it
to take advantage of sb's misfortune/to loot
(coll.) to grab money/to rake in money
lit. to pull chestnuts out of the fire (idiom)/fig. to be sb's cat's-paw
extra income
lit. a cup of soup/fig. to get part of the profits/one's share of the action
to seize the opportunity
